definitions.title: n.pr.loc.
definitions.body: Rabba (prop. great or populous,  sc. city);—

capital of Ammonites explicitly, [[רַבַּת בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן]] 2Sa 12:26, 2Sa 12:27, 2Sa 17:27, De 3:11, Je 49:2, Ez Eze 21:25; [[רַבָּה]] alone 2Sa 11:1 ‖ 1Ch 20:1, 1Ch 20:1, Am 1:14, Je 49:3, Ez Eze 25:5, Jos 13:25 (P); c.[[ה]] loc. [[רַבָָּתָה]] 2Sa 12:29; in GK. Period Philadelphia, Lag:onom 215, 94:219, 82 (but RabbatmanaPolyb:v. 71.4), mod ‘Ammân, 13 ½ m. NE. from Heshbon, 28 ½ m .E. of Jordan; cf. Buhl:Geogr.260;- LXX Rabbaq, Rabba
[[הָרַבָּה]] city in Judah Jos 15:60 (P), site unknow;—LXX Swqhba, A LXXL Arebba.
